headline.main: HEALTH FOOD COMPANY IS INDICTED ON PROMOTION OF OIL OF PRIMROSE

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration announced today that General Nutrition Inc., which runs a chain of 1,000 health-food stores, had been indicted on charges of improperly promoting one of its products, oil of primrose. Gary A. Daum, the president of General Nutrition, the country's largest chain of health stores, was also indicted, as were two other officers. Managers of two stores in upstate New York, where the Federal agency gathered evidence, were also charged. The indictment was returned by a Federal grand jury in Buffalo.
